para.text: A supervisor shall not threaten to take or take a prohibited personnel action or otherwise retaliate against an employee because of the employee’s protected disclosure or because of an employee’s refusal to comply with an illegal order.

A District government official or employee having the responsibility to evaluate, award, authorize payments, terminate, or otherwise administer a contract for goods or services between the District government and a contractor shall not threaten to take or take a prohibited procurement action against a contractor, or a contractor competing for a contract, based wholly or in part on a protected disclosure made by an employee, officer, or owner of the contractor to a public body.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 1-615.55, § 2-223.03, and § 2-223.04.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 18-117 rewrote the section, which had read as follows: “A supervisor shall not threaten to take or take a prohibited personnel action or otherwise retaliate against an employee because of the employee’s protected disclosure or because of an employee’s refusal to comply with an illegal order.”

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of subchapter, see note to § 2-223.01.
